msItem.author: Taio, Bishop of Saragossa
msItem.title: Sententiarum libri quinque

msItem.incipit: (fol. 2r) Domino mihi ualde uenerabili atque sanctissimo Giuirico

msItem.rubric: (fol. 4r) Incipiunt capitulationes de libro primo sententiarum
(fol. 7r) Quod deus incommutabilis summus et aeternus existat
msItem.incipit: Solus Deus in semetispe incommutabilis est
msItem.colophon: Bene mihi domine quia haec omnia scriptum est: deo gratias amen. Felix sit qui scripsit.

msItem.bibl: CPL 1268; PL 80.727-990 (the printed text ending incomplete in V.33 at 'ardeant in mente', here fol. 184ra12); edition by Aquilar Miguel listed as forthcoming by CPL, Jan. 2022.
msItem.note: Bk. II, fol. 37v; III, fols. 92v-93r; IV, fol. 126r; V, fol. 160r-v.

Fol. 1r blank except for 'nicpuiae' (?) and pen trial beginning 'adsum ...'; fol. 187r blank except for offset of 'impeda' on fol. 186v; fol. 187v blank except for pen trials including 'Pater noster', 'Ecce vere Ishrahelita ...' (cf. Cantus index 006862a), 'Gaude visceribus ...' (cf. Cantus index 008307).
On fol. 89r hadarat is an early annotation, possibly as suggested by Bischoff the name of a corrector.

supportDesc.collation: 1(6+1, last leaf added) (fols. 1-7), 2(8)-4(8) (fols. 8-31), 5(6) (fols. 32-7), 6(8)-18(8) (fols. 38-141), 19(6) (fols. 142-7), 20(8) (fols. 148-155), 21(6) (fols. 156-161), 22(8)-24(8) (fols. 162-177), 25(2) (fols. 186-7). Quires 1-24 with contemporary lettering A-Z on the final verso; quires 1-25 with later medieval bifolium signatures in a sequence running a-n (quires 1-14), o/r (quire 13, r corrected to o on three occasions), s-z (quires 15-20), et, con, 4, 5 (quires 21-24); for similar signatures cf. e.g. MSS. Laud Lat. 21, Laud Misc. 417.
supportDesc.condition: Water damage throughout, in places with loss of text; positioning of the later medieval leaf signatures indicates that the damage occured before these were added.

layoutDesc.layout: 2 columns, usually of 28 lines (but e.g. fols. 126r-133v, 27 lines; fols. 136r-139v, 25 lines); ruled space 225 165 (to inner vertical bounding lines).

handDesc.handNote: Rubrics and opening line of chapters typically in uncial.
Fol. 1v filled with a rubric in square capitals.
Other rubrics occasionally in rustic capitals.

decoDesc.decoNote: The opening lines of bk. I, chs. 1-3 (fols. 7r, 8v, 9r) in uncial in yellow (fols. 7r, 9r) or black (fol. 8v) on a crimson (fol. 7r), yellow (fol. 8v) or green (fol. 9r) ground in a plain red (fol. yr), green (fol. 8v) or crimson (fol. 9r) border; decorated initial 'S' on fol. 7r in yellow and red extending into animal heads.

Larger initials at the beginning of most books: 'O' in red and black with reserved ground, fol. 37v; elaborate interlace 'I' in black, fol. 93r; interlace 'O' in black, red, and yellow, fol. 126r; plain black 'O', fol. 160v.
Each section typically with a 3-line plain ink initial, occasionally with modest decorative elements (e.g. fols. 21v, 92r, 109r, 166v (with a face)).

physDesc.additions: Occasional corrections to the text (e.g. fols. 53v, 71r) and alterations to punctuation, including added flex punctuation.

binding.p: A standard binding of the Laudian collection, calf over pasteboard with the Laudian arms in gilt on each cover; rebacked.
Former chained binding: marks of a chain-staple fol. 1, top centre.

history.provenance: Associated by Bischoff with two other manuscripts (BAV Pal. Lat. 246 and MS. Laud Misc. 452 fols. 1-191) of uncertain origin, not identifiable as written at Lorsch (although perhaps from its area), but corrected there in the ninth century.

Lorsch, Benedictine abbey: identifiable in the Carolingian library catalogues (A. Häse, Mittelalterliche Bücherverzeichnisse aus Kloster Lorsch. Einleitung, Edition und Kommentar (2002), no. 185, p. 258).

Eberbach, Cistercian abbey: probably one of the manuscripts transferred from Lorsch to Eberbach in the second quarter of the thirteenth century. Seemingly identifiable as H6 in the catalogue of 1502: 'Sentencie beati gregorii Initium Dominus michi valde etc.' (Nigel F. Palmer, Zisterzienser und ihre Bücher: die mittelalterliche Bibliotheksgeschichte von Kloster Eberbach im Rheingau (Regensburg, 1998), pp. 18, 98-101, 239).
history.acquisition: Part of his third donation to the Bodleian, 1639; former shelfmark H. 47 (inside cover).

recordHist.source: Description by Matthew Holford, Jan. 2021; previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 314 Quarto Catalogue, col. 315 Quarto Catalogue, p. 562 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 56

B. Bischoff, Katalog der festländischen Handschriften des neunten Jahrhunderts (mit Ausnahme der wisigotischen), vol. 2, Laon-Paderborn (Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz Verlag 2004) no. 3861
Bernhard Bischoff, Die Abtei Lorsch im Spiegel ihrer Handschriften, 2nd ed. (1989), 41, 112-3
Otto Pächt and J. J. G. Alexander, Illuminated Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library Oxford, I (1966), no. 12
